required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Efficacy and Safety of Triple Therapy of Telmisartan/Amlodipine/Rosuvastatin
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, Randomized, Parallel Phase IV Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Triple Therapy of Telmisartan/Amlodipine/Rosuvastatin in Patients With Dyslipidemia and Hypertension

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study was to assess the efficacy and safety of FDC therapy with triple therapy of Telmisartan 40 mg/Amlodipine 5 mg/Rosuvastatin 10mg in Korean patients with both hypertension and dyslipidemia.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients were randomly assigned to 2 groups: (1) Triple therapy (40mg of telmisartan and 5mg of amlodipine and 10mg of rosuvastatin); (2) Dual therapy (5mg of amlodipine and 10mg of atorvastatin). After 8 weeks of treatment, the change in mean sitting systolic blood pressure (MSSBP) and the percent change in LDL-C between 2 group, will be compared.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent changes in mean sitting systolic blood pressure (MSSBP)
primary_outcome.description: Percent changes in MSSBP from baseline after 8 weeks of treatment
Percent changes in LDL-C from baseline after 8 weeks of treatment

secondary_outcome.description: Percent changes in LDL-C from baseline after 4 weeks of treatment
Percent changes in TC from baseline after 4 and 8 weeks of treatment
Percent changes in TG from baseline after 4 and 8 weeks of treatment
Percent changes in HDL-C from baseline after 4 and 8 weeks of treatment
Percent changes in Non-HDL-C from baseline after 4 and 8 weeks of treatement
Percent changes in Apo B from baseline after 4 and 8 weeks of treatment
Percent changes in Apo A-I from baseline after 4 and 8 weeks of treatment
Percent changes in LDL-C/HDL-C from baseline after 4 and 8 weeks of treatement

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent changes in Apo B/Apo A-I ratio
secondary_outcome.description: Percent changes in Apo B/Apo A-I from baseline after 4 and 8 weeks of treatment
Percent changes in hs-CRP from baseline after 4 and 8 weeks of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: The percentage of patients achieving treatment goal for blood pressure and LDL-C
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of patients achieving treatment goal for blood pressure and LDL-C

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in mean sitting systolic/diastolic blood pressure
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in mean sitting systolic/diastolic blood pressure after 4 and 8 weeks of treatment

intervention.description: Wash out/run in period with Amlodipine 5mg for 6 weeks and then treatment with triple therapy (Newstatin TS 40/5/10mg) ; 1 tab qd for 8 weeks
Wash out/run in period with Amlodipine 5mg for 6 weeks and then treatment with dual therapy (Caduet 5/10mg) ; 1 tab qd for 8 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 145 mmHg ≤ msSBP ≤ 190 mmHg
- Triglycerides < 500 mg/dL
- LDL-C ≤ 250 mg/dL
Exclusion Criteria:
- sSBP ≥ 20mmHg and sDBP ≥ 10mmHg
- symptomatic orthostatic hypotension and secondary/iatrogenic hypertension and dyslipidemia
- history of moderate to severe cerebral ischemia, cerebral hemorrhage, transient ischemic attack, myocardial infarction, or unstable angina in the past 6 months; severe heart failure (New York Heart Association functional class III and IV)
- hypersensitivity to telmisartan or rosuvastatin
- history of angioedema after treatment with angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors or ARBs; creatinine phosphokinase levels ≥3 times the upper limit of normal
- estimated glomerular filtration rate ≤30 mL/min; aspartate aminotransferase and alanine aminotransferase levels ≥3 times the upper limit of normal
- potassium levels >5.5 mmol/L; or any diseases that could affect the results of the study.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director, Coronary Intervention & Transcatheter Aortic Valve Implantation
